reviewText: February 28, 1983, marked a major watershed in American network television.  "Goodbye, Farewell and Amen", the last original episode of the CBS series "M*A*S*H", became the highest-rated single television program in American history and is still revered nearly 30 years after its initial broadcast.Eschewing history, mainly because I wasn't a big fan of "M*A*S*H", I was tuned to rival network NBC to watch "The Night The Bridge Fell Down", yet another disaster thriller from Irwin Allen, who staked his claim to fame with the theatrical releases "The Poseidon Adventure" and "The Towering Inferno".  Originally made in 1979, "Bridge" was intended for release on network television in 1980, but it got pushed back to 1983.The biggest names involved with "Bridge" are James MacArthur (Danny "Dan-O" Williams on the long-running CBS crime drama "Hawaii Five-O"), who plays an engineer desperately trying to get an unsafe bridge shut down; Leslie Nielsen (the captain of the ill-fated S.S. Poseidon in 1972) as a man who has stepped out on his wife, but is trying to get his sick baby to the hospital; Eve Plumb (Jan Brady on the hit ABC comedy "The Brady Bunch") as a woman who works for an orphanage; and Gregory Sierra (the ill-fated bartender Carlos in "The Towering Inferno" in 1974).  Desi Arnaz, Jr., son of the late actors Lucille Ball and Dezi Arnaz, is also on hand as a man on the run with his fiance (Char Fontane) after a bank robbery."Bridge", predictably, puts everyone in harm's way in fairly short order, and it tells some of their stories in flashback form.  Though the flashbacks help us understand why Arnaz's character turned to crime and why Plumb's character turns to the church, they do tend to slow the action down just a bit.  Somewhat unpredictably, the breeches buoy makes another appearance in an Irwin Allen film, although it was used with the same limited success that it was used in "The Towering Inferno".  And unlike "The Towering Inferno", Gregory Sierra's character lives to fight another day.For what it is, "Bridge" is not a bad movie.  It certainly makes for a wonderful answer to a trivia question, and for fans of disaster movies and/or Irwin Allen, it's definitely worth the purchase.
summary: Instead of the last episode of "M*A*S*H", I watched this.

reviewText: A bridge is in danger of falling down,and when parts do and only the center is left standing and there are people that are trapped on top with A bank robber who's losing it A wounded cop and several other people its going to be very tricky to get them all down and most of them do get down.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had no problem with this DVD.  I bought it from Amazon and it works fine.  now, the TV movie.  Well, it is TV.  Very cheesy.  The effects were fair or awful, but typical TV disaster film stuff.  You have all of the regular types there.  The couple that is breaking up, the sick child, the bank robber, the man with the heart of gold.  What I did like was that Dezi Arnes Jr plays the bad guy.  Nice to see him doing something different.  He did a fine job.  The movie is dragged out to 3 hrs, which means lots of false starts, failed rescues and pleanty of suspense. It is suspenceful once they are in the middle of the bridge and both sides fall down, leaving the actors on a small center piller. The fact that only a few cops, fire fighter and rescuers show up is noticable.  If something like this really happended,  there would have been media crews all over the place.  Another plus for the film is Eve Plumb,  who you dont see to often outside of the Bradys.  She is a good actress and does well in her role.  Yes I reccomend this film.  I am also a big Irwin Allen fan and he produced this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Some of us have had a discussion in the comments section about this movie and it's defects.  I purchased one from Warner and it was defective - the one I purchased from amazon.com was PERFECT!!!What I enjoy about Irwin Allen's disaster movies is the vignette's that portray the people, their lives and why they were on the Bridge or in the tram car or whatever. Makes the movie more interesting.I loved this movie.  It is a palm sweating movie.  A number of people are trapped on a Bridge including a thief, a very ill baby, a child, a policeman who had been shot, and a few others.  The Bridge had been declared unsafe by the City Engineer but the City had refused to shut the Bridge down.  The left and right ends of the bridge collapses leaving our small group of people stranded on a postage size stamp of concrete suspended in the air.I am not going to tell you how anyone is rescued because that is the movie.  It is a keeper.  Very similar in some respects to the Poseidon Adventure and The Towering Inferno.ENJOY!
Title: N/A

reviewText: JAMES MacARTHUR heads an all-star cast that contains: DESI ARNAZJR.,CHAR FONTANE,RICHARD M.GILLIAND,LESLIE NIELSEN,EVE PLUMB,BARBARA RUSH,and GREGORY SIERRA.From the legendary producer ofstar-laden disaster epics,IRWIN ALLEN,comes the interesting storyof an entire group of 9 people trapped on a bridge that has partially given away on both sides and still threatens to collapse at any moment!There's also another problem with that ofa gun-wielding bank robber(DESI ARNAZ JR.)who uses the bridge ashis escape route,refusing to let rescue workers draw near!If youlove nail-biting suspense and edge of your seat adventure then"THE NIGHT THE BRIDGE FELL DOWN" is the one for you!And what'salso so great about this movie is the lack of profanity and sexthat is so exploited,not only just on the big screen but also ontelevision as well.This is a suspense-filled movie that both youand your entire family can enjoy!!!!!
summary: Fun Disaster Movie That The Whole Family Can Enjoy!!!!!
